A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
While not a perfect film\, and not the best in the Saga. The Last Jedi was a brilliantly executed\, fun\, surprising and thoroughly entertaining film.  I personally didn't feel the run-time while watching it\, and like most others criticisms against the film\, the Finn/Rose storyline did bog down the middle of the film and feel a little out of place.  While Rose is a nice addition and very well acted\, you can tell she enjoyed her time filming throughout\, you almost wish they had stronger material and a more worthwhile subplot which kept you more engaged instead of wishing you'd get back to Luke and Rey on the island.
Mark Hamill nails this portrayal of a jaded\, and frightened Luke Skywalker. Utterly mesmerizing\, and you can see how far his character has come from the frustrated dreamer of A New Hope.
Carrie FIsher also shines and what a fitting way for her to end (albeit unexpectedly at the time) from the franchise and her tribute in the credits brought a round of applause from those I saw the film with.
Utterly brilliant and a worthy entry in the saga.  Can't wait for Episode IX.
